intro: Houstonia ciliolata, commonly known as the slender bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, small, white or pale blue flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has thin, hairy stems and small, opposite leaves. Houstonia ciliolata is often found in sandy or loamy soils and is adapted to thrive in humid, temperate climates.
